title: How to Eat a Tim Tam

steps.headline: Choose a drink to dunk your Tim Tam in.
steps.description: Hot chocolate is the most popular drink of choice for a Tim Tam Slam. Coffee, mochaccino, tea, Irish cream, and port are other popular and delicious options. You can use almost any beverage as long it is hot and isn’t too thick. For example, a thick smoothie would be hard to suck through the Tim Tam and wouldn’t melt the chocolate.

steps.headline: Buy some “original” Tim Tams.
steps.description: If you live in Australia or New Zealand, purchase a packet of Tim Tams from your local supermarket. If you live elsewhere, you may find it harder to find these delicious chocolate biscuits. Check the international aisle at the supermarket, look in an international grocery store, or buy them online. There are lots of different flavoured Tim Tams. Start with the “original” flavour and then try out the other flavours to find your favourite.

steps.headline: Take small bites out of the 2 diagonally opposite corners.
steps.description: The aim of the Tim Tam Slam is to use the biscuit as a straw. Make a small bite in one of the corners of the Tim Tam. Take a second small bite in the corner that is diagonally opposite your first bite. Bite far enough into the Tim Tam to reveal the chocolate layers. This will make it easier to slurp the beverage through the biscuit.

steps.headline: Suck your beverage through the Tim Tam.
steps.description: Dip one of the bitten corners into your drink and then slurp the beverage through the other bitten corner. The drink will melt the middle of the Tim Tam, releasing delicious chocolate goo into your mouth. The process can be a bit messy once the chocolate starts to melt so keep a paper towel on hand. The Tim Tam will quickly start to absorb the liquid so you will need to suck the drink quite swiftly. You will likely only be able to get 1 slurp from each Tim Tam before it melts. If your beverage is really hot, wait a few minutes for it to cool before attempting to drink it quickly.

steps.headline: Eat the remaining Tim Tam once it starts to crumble.
steps.description: The liquid will quickly absorb into the Tim Tam, making it gooey and floppy. Quickly pop it in your mouth before it falls into your drink. Savour the delicious mix of flavours that you have created and then pick up another Tim Tam for another slam! If you have clean hands, lick your fingers to enjoy the rest of the melted chocolate.

steps.headline: Select a flavour of Tim Tam.
steps.description: Head down to your local supermarket and stand in the Tim Tam section. Consider what flavour chocolate you feel like eating. The Tim Tam range offers dark, milk, and white chocolate options. If you feel like something a bit different, choose a Tim Tam with a sweet gooey filling. Mint, caramel, Turkish delight, and iced coffee are popular and delicious options. If you’re not sure which flavour to choose, why not treat yourself and buy 2 packets?

steps.headline: Bite into the Tim Tam.
steps.description: Take a Tim Tam out of the packet and hold it in your hand. Slowly bite into it so that you can appreciate it’s different layers. Enjoy the different textures within each layer. 1 Tim Tam equals 1 standard serving.

steps.headline: Savour the flavour.
steps.description: Turn your full attention to the different flavours of the Tim Tam as you eat it. Allow yourself to be transported to a blissful chocolate reality as you chew each bite. Appreciate the different flavours of each layer inside the Tim Tam and savour the taste. Try different flavours of Tim Tams to help you determine which one is your favourite.

steps.headline: Dunk the Tim Tam in a warm drink if you enjoy melted chocolate.
steps.description: Dip the end of the Tim Tam into a warm beverage. Hot chocolate, tea, and coffee are all delicious options. Lick the melted chocolate off the biscuit and then pop the rest of the biscuit into your mouth before it crumbles.

steps.headline: Use Tim Tams as the base of your cheesecake to give extra flavour.
steps.description: If you’re feeling like a treat, try replacing the crushed biscuits in your cheesecake base with crushed Tim Tams. Simply crush the Tim Tams as per usual and you have yourself a delicious chocolate cheesecake base. Use flavoured Tim Tams to give the base a unique taste.

steps.headline: Add Tim Tams to a milkshake to make a delicious dessert.
steps.description: Blend 4 scoops of chocolate ice cream, 8 frozen raspberries, 1 cup (250 mL) of milk, and 5 crushed Tim Tams. Blend the ingredients until the milkshake is creamy and frothy. Serve the smoothie immediately to experience the flavours at their best. Original Tim Tams work best for this recipe but if you feel like a change of flavour, dry dark or milk Tim Tams.

steps.headline: Make Tim Tam ice cream sandwiches if you feel like a sweet treat.
steps.description: This quick snack is really easy and incredibly delicious. Simply cut slices of chocolate ice cream and place it between 2 Tim Tams. If you’re not in a rush, place the ice cream sandwich overnight to freeze the Tim Tams. This will make the sandwich easier to eat as the chocolate won’t melt.

steps.headline: Add Tim Tams to your fudge to add extra crunch.
steps.description: This simple recipe only requires 3 ingredients and takes a mere 5 minute to cook in the microwave. Combine 1 x 395g tin (1.25 cups) of sweetened condensed milk with 375 melted chocolate melts (2 cups). Stir 1 packet of lightly crushed Tim Tams to the mixture and then pour it into a tin. Leave the fudge to set in the fridge for 3 hours and then enjoy. Experiment with different flavours of Tim Tams to vary the taste of the fudge.

text: Doing the Tim Tam Slam Choose a drink to dunk your Tim Tam in. Hot chocolate is the most popular drink of choice for a Tim Tam Slam. Coffee, mochaccino, tea, Irish cream, and port are other popular and delicious options. You can use almost any beverage as long it is hot and isn’t too thick. For example, a thick smoothie would be hard to suck through the Tim Tam and wouldn’t melt the chocolate. Buy some “original” Tim Tams. If you live in Australia or New Zealand, purchase a packet of Tim Tams from your local supermarket. If you live elsewhere, you may find it harder to find these delicious chocolate biscuits. Check the international aisle at the supermarket, look in an international grocery store, or buy them online. There are lots of different flavoured Tim Tams. Start with the “original” flavour and then try out the other flavours to find your favourite. Take small bites out of the 2 diagonally opposite corners. The aim of the Tim Tam Slam is to use the biscuit as a straw. Make a small bite in one of the corners of the Tim Tam. Take a second small bite in the corner that is diagonally opposite your first bite. Bite far enough into the Tim Tam to reveal the chocolate layers. This will make it easier to slurp the beverage through the biscuit. Suck your beverage through the Tim Tam. Dip one of the bitten corners into your drink and then slurp the beverage through the other bitten corner. The drink will melt the middle of the Tim Tam, releasing delicious chocolate goo into your mouth. The process can be a bit messy once the chocolate starts to melt so keep a paper towel on hand. The Tim Tam will quickly start to absorb the liquid so you will need to suck the drink quite swiftly. You will likely only be able to get 1 slurp from each Tim Tam before it melts. If your beverage is really hot, wait a few minutes for it to cool before attempting to drink it quickly. Eat the remaining Tim Tam once it starts to crumble. The liquid will quickly absorb into the Tim Tam, making it gooey and floppy. Quickly pop it in your mouth before it falls into your drink. Savour the delicious mix of flavours that you have created and then pick up another Tim Tam for another slam! If you have clean hands, lick your fingers to enjoy the rest of the melted chocolate. Taking a Bite Select a flavour of Tim Tam. Head down to your local supermarket and stand in the Tim Tam section. Consider what flavour chocolate you feel like eating. The Tim Tam range offers dark, milk, and white chocolate options. If you feel like something a bit different, choose a Tim Tam with a sweet gooey filling. Mint, caramel, Turkish delight, and iced coffee are popular and delicious options. If you’re not sure which flavour to choose, why not treat yourself and buy 2 packets? Bite into the Tim Tam. Take a Tim Tam out of the packet and hold it in your hand. Slowly bite into it so that you can appreciate it’s different layers. Enjoy the different textures within each layer. 1 Tim Tam equals 1 standard serving. Savour the flavour. Turn your full attention to the different flavours of the Tim Tam as you eat it. Allow yourself to be transported to a blissful chocolate reality as you chew each bite. Appreciate the different flavours of each layer inside the Tim Tam and savour the taste. Try different flavours of Tim Tams to help you determine which one is your favourite. Dunk the Tim Tam in a warm drink if you enjoy melted chocolate. Dip the end of the Tim Tam into a warm beverage. Hot chocolate, tea, and coffee are all delicious options. Lick the melted chocolate off the biscuit and then pop the rest of the biscuit into your mouth before it crumbles. Using Tim Tams in Baking Use Tim Tams as the base of your cheesecake to give extra flavour. If you’re feeling like a treat, try replacing the crushed biscuits in your cheesecake base with crushed Tim Tams. Simply crush the Tim Tams as per usual and you have yourself a delicious chocolate cheesecake base. Use flavoured Tim Tams to give the base a unique taste. Add Tim Tams to a milkshake to make a delicious dessert. Blend 4 scoops of chocolate ice cream, 8 frozen raspberries, 1 cup (250 mL) of milk, and 5 crushed Tim Tams. Blend the ingredients until the milkshake is creamy and frothy. Serve the smoothie immediately to experience the flavours at their best. Original Tim Tams work best for this recipe but if you feel like a change of flavour, dry dark or milk Tim Tams. Make Tim Tam ice cream sandwiches if you feel like a sweet treat. This quick snack is really easy and incredibly delicious. Simply cut slices of chocolate ice cream and place it between 2 Tim Tams. If you’re not in a rush, place the ice cream sandwich overnight to freeze the Tim Tams. This will make the sandwich easier to eat as the chocolate won’t melt. Add Tim Tams to your fudge to add extra crunch. This simple recipe only requires 3 ingredients and takes a mere 5 minute to cook in the microwave. Combine 1 x 395g tin (1.25 cups) of sweetened condensed milk with 375 melted chocolate melts (2 cups). Stir 1 packet of lightly crushed Tim Tams to the mixture and then pour it into a tin. Leave the fudge to set in the fridge for 3 hours and then enjoy. Experiment with different flavours of Tim Tams to vary the taste of the fudge.
